messages.title: A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM DAVID CAMERON
messages.content: Thirteen years ago Labour were elected promising change. But today, with the economy in a mess and a growing gap between rich and poor, a lot of people feel let down.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reduce public spending, keep taxes as low as possible and tackle the deficit.
Prevent the commercialisation of parts of the health service, protect core values, but bring some local management and outlet for complaints.
Raise standards in state education system, reduce bureaucratic control per head and give schools freedom to run their own affairs.

issues.economy: Reduce public spending, keep taxes as low as possible and tackle the deficit.
issues.education: We need to raise standards in our state education system.
issues.environment: Kenneth Clarke has always called for the abolition of the Hunting Act.
issues.health: Would this [proposed changes] damage the National Health Service?
issues.socialWelfare: We'll help your family budget by working with local councils to freeze council tax for two years.

housing.content: Kenneth Clarke has helped ensure the development plan to regenerate Cotgrave will go ahead.

leaflet.personalStatement: Kenneth Clarke is known within Parliament for integrity and for standing up for the interests of the local people.

contactInformation.address: Rushcliffe Conservative Association, Rectory Road, West Bridgford, Nottingham, NG2 6BG
